Christophe,

I tried the links and they seem to be working. Maybe there was a
temporary network problem.

There is a tar file containing the version 1.1 C++ source you can
download. I will soon post the version 1.2 source too.
Documentation is still incomplete, but version 1.2 will have several
small example C++ programs that show how to do most things of interest.

Dave Goodwin



-----Original Message-----
From: matignonc [mailto:christophe.matignon@...] 
Sent: Thursday, March 28, 2002 4:57 AM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] Downloading Cantera1.2


Dear Dave Goodwin,

I could try cantera for python, and I was very impressed.

Now I would be very interested in using it directly from my own CFD or
Detonation codes (which are written in c++).

However I cannot connect to either URL http://www.cantera.org nor URL
http://adam.caltech.edu. 

So you would help me a lot if you could tell me from where I can get
cantera1.2+doc for c++.

Congratulation for Cantera


Christophe MATIGNON
